title: Warli Art
subtitle: A Tribal Expression of Life and Nature
overview: Warli Art is a traditional tribal painting style from the Warli tribes of Maharashtra, mainly found in the Thane and Palghar regions.
These simple yet profound artworks depict daily life, farming, festivals, and human connection with nature using geometric forms.

highlights.title: Traditional Art
highlights.description: Created using rice paste on mud walls with bamboo brushes.

highlights.title: Cultural Symbolism
highlights.description: Warli paintings represent the harmony between human and nature.

geography.intro: The Warli tribe resides in hilly and coastal regions of northern Maharashtra.

climate.description: Warli regions have tropical climate with moderate rainfall.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: November to February

geography.conclusion: Warli art beautifully blends simplicity, symbolism, and spirituality.

activities.title: Learn Warli Painting
activities.description: Join workshops organized by tribal artists.

activities.title: Buy Warli Crafts
activities.description: Explore handmade Warli artwork, textiles, and pottery.

attractions.title: Warli Villages
attractions.description: Visit traditional homes decorated with Warli paintings.

attractions.title: Warli Museum
attractions.description: A cultural museum preserving Warli heritage.

marineLife.intro: Warli art often symbolizes natural balance, though not related to marine life.

items.title: Nature Motifs
items.description: Trees, rivers, and animals feature prominently.
